great.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: very large in amount or degree
great.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The movie was a great success.
The news came as possibly the greatest shock of my life.
The paintings cost a great deal (=a lot) of money.
John always takes great care over his work.
It gives me great pleasure (=I am very pleased) to introduce tonight’s speaker.
It’s a great pity that none of his poems survive.
The temptation was too great to resist.
great.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: a great day out for all the family
I worked out this morning and I feel great.
You look great in that dress.
Email’s great for keeping in touch.
The great thing about Alex is that he’s always willing to explain things to you.
great.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: important or having a lot of influence
great.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: one of the greatest scientific achievements of our time
What makes a novel truly great?
great.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used in the title of a person or event that was very important in the past
great.translation[0].definitions[3].note: the Great War old-fashioned (=World War I)
great.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I’m reading a biography of Alexander the Great.
great.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: very good or generous in a way that people admire
great.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: famous for being able to do something extremely well
great.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Ali was undoubtedly one of the greatest boxers of all time.
a book about the lives of the great composers
great.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: A great iron stove filled half the room.
great.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: used to emphasize that someone does something a lot
great.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: Len was a great believer in the power of positive thinking.
Anthony’s a great talker – sometimes you just can’t get a word in.
She’s a great one for telling stories about her schooldays.
be a great one for doing something
great.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: used when you are disappointed or annoyed about something
great.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: used in the names of some animals or plants, especially when they are bigger than other animals or plants of the same type
great.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a very successful and famous person in a particular sport, profession etc
great.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Jack Nicklaus is one of golf’s all-time greats.
I think his show’s OK, but I wouldn’t call him one of the greats.
